subject: Soccer
Palestinians
lead_paragraph: The Palestinian soccer team will play its first international game at home when it faces Jordan on Oct. 26 in a renovated stadium. For 10 years the team has been playing home games in Jordan and Qatar. But its stadium in Ram has been upgraded to meet standards set by soccer’s governing body, FIFA, and will be opened by Sepp Blatter, FIFA’s president. “It is very important to FIFA that countries are able to play their home matches in their own stadium,” Pekka Odriozola, a FIFA spokesman, said Friday.
